intro: Psychotria octocuspis, commonly known as the "Cocaine plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon basin. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It produces berries that contain alkaloids, including cocaine, which are harvested for pharmaceutical and illicit purposes. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is also of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological research.
